com.ojcoleman.europa.core

Class Genotype<A extends Allele<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.Observable
      • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.ConfigurableBase
        • com.ojcoleman.europa.configurable.PrototypeBase
          • com.ojcoleman.europa.core.Genotype<A>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Stringable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DummyGenotype, VectorGeneGenotype

    public abstract class Genotype<A extends Allele<?>>
extends PrototypeBase
implements Stringable

    Represents the inheritable genetic material of an Individual.

    Sub-classes must implement a PrototypeBase.PrototypeBase(PrototypeBase) type copy-constructor accepting only the allele to copy, which should generally just call super() with the given allele.

    Note that an Allele belongs to a specific Genotype, but may share the same Gene as Alleles in other Genotypes. Alleles and Genotypes directly reference one another, but a Gene is only referenced by Alleles. A given Gene should only be included once in a Genotype.

    Author:
    O. J. Coleman

    • Field Detail

      • parents

        public final java.util.List<Genotype<?>> parents
        The parent(s) of this Genotype (as an unmodifiable List).

        protected final java.util.Collection<A extends Allele<?>> alleles
        The alleles in this genotype. Each Allele references a Gene.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Genotype

        public Genotype(Configuration config)
        PrototypeBase constructor. See PrototypeBase.PrototypeBase(Configuration).

      • Genotype

        public Genotype(Genotype<A> prototype)
        Copy constructor. See PrototypeBase.PrototypeBase(PrototypeBase). Create a Genotype with the same alleles and genes as the given genotype. The parent is set to the given prototype.
        Parameters:
        prototype - The (prototype) instance to copy.

      • Genotype

        public Genotype(Genotype<A> prototype,
        java.util.Collection<A> alleles,
        java.util.List<Genotype<?>> parents)
        Copy constructor. See PrototypeBase.PrototypeBase(PrototypeBase). Create a Genotype with the given alleles and parents.
        Parameters:
        prototype - The (prototype) instance to copy.
        alleles - The Alleles (backed by Genes) that make up the new Genotype. A copy of each allele is made and put into a new collection.
        parents - The parents that were used to create this genotype (this is for record keeping only, implementations of this class do not need to create new instances from multiple parents (this is the job of Recombiners).

    • Method Detail

      • newAlleleCollection

        protected abstract java.util.Collection<A> newAlleleCollection()
        Create and return a new Collection to be used to store Alleles. This is used by the Genotype constructors. This allows sub-classes to specify the kind of Collection to use to store alleles. For example should it be a List, a Set, a SortedSet, a HashSet...?

      • getAlleles

        public java.util.Collection<A> getAlleles()
        Get the alleles of this genotype as an unmodifiable collection. The iterator of the returned collection will iterate over the alleles in the same order as the collection provided to the constructor.

      • hasAllelesOfType

        public boolean hasAllelesOfType(java.lang.Object type)
        Returns true iff this genotype contains alleles for Genes of the specified type.
        Parameters:
        type - Object representing the type, usually an enum constant.

      • getAllelesOfType

        public java.util.List<A> getAllelesOfType(java.lang.Object type)
        Get the list of alleles in this genotype that are for Genes of the specified type. Note that an allele/gene pair may have multiple types.
        Parameters:
        type - Object representing the type, usually an enum constant.
        Returns:
        The list of alleles in this genotype that are for Genes of the specified type, in the same order as the Collection provided to Genotype(Genotype, Collection, List) iterates over those alleles. If no alleles of the specified type exist then an empty list is returned.
        See Also:
        hasAllelesOfType(Object)

      • getAllelesOfType

        public java.util.List<A> getAllelesOfType(java.lang.Object type,
                                 java.util.List<A> defaultList)
        Get the list of alleles in this genotype that are for Genes of the specified type, or a provided default list if there are no alleles of specified type present. Note that an allele/gene pair may have multiple types.
        Parameters:
        type - Object representing the type, usually an enum constant.
        defaultList - A list of default values to return if there are no alleles of specified type present. May be null.
        Returns:
        The list of alleles in this genotype that are for Genes of the specified type, in the same order as the Set provided to Genotype(Genotype, Collection, List) iterates over those alleles.
        See Also:
        hasAllelesOfType(Object)

      • addAllele

        public void addAllele(A allele)
        Add the given Allele to this genotype. This method should generally only be called by Mutators and Recombiners.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the given Allele has already been added to a Genotype. It must be removed from the Genotype it currently belongs to first by calling removeAllele(Allele).

      • removeAllele

        public void removeAllele(A allele)
        Remove the given allele from this genotype. This method should generally only be called by Mutators and Recombiners.

      • getStringableMap

        public void getStringableMap(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> map)
        Description copied from interface: Stringable
        Populate the given map, which is typically to be converted into a String by Stringer.toString(Object). When overriding this method in a sub-class the super-class implementation should usually be called from the overriding implementation.
        Specified by:
        getStringableMap in interface Stringable
        Overrides:
        getStringableMap in class ConfigurableBase
        Parameters:
        map - Mapping from descriptive labels to Objects that can be converted into a String by Stringer.toString(Object).
